p: However, the amino acid sequence of avian H2N9 isolates, including our strain, is different from that of human isolates at positions 226 and 228 (H3 numbering) because only human isolates (H2N2) exhibit different amino acids in 220 loop (residues 221 to 228) [ 30]. According to the HA phylogenic tree of H2 subtypes, H2N9 originated in swine and dispersed to two different clades: human and avian.
